name: places/ChIJ5aa60bdZwokRMAJHizpx_O4
adrFormatAddress: 764 9th Ave, New York, NY 10019-6321, USA

originalText.text:
Best chicken sandwiches in the city; so good.

Went with friends and tried the Seoul, Banh Mi, and Nashville Hot chicken sandwiches.  All had the perfect combination of texture and flavor. Everything went together so well with a blast of flavors in every bite.

Will definitely be back to try more of the menu.

text.text:

originalText.text:
I regret leaving a bad review but I had food poisoning through the holidays after eating here. For 3 days the symptoms lasted of chills, dizziness, fatigue, fever, lightheadedness, loss of appetite, malaise, sweating, bloating, diarrhea**, indigestion, nausea, vomiting, stomach cramps.
I fasted for a full 24 hours because my stomach couldn't take anything. I had never felt this sick in my life.
I will not be coming back here unfortunately.
To add, the cashier sprayed cleaning products near my food while I was eating which was inconsiderate.
The chicken was over fried, I should have known something wasn't right when I took the first bite and the oil on the skin tasted rancid.

originalText.text: Their truffle fries are the bomb! It's so crispy and flavorful! Definitely a fave! I ordered the Deluxe Chicken sandwich and it was divine!  Crispy on the outside, juicy on the inside!!

text.text: Their truffle fries are the bomb! It's so crispy and flavorful! Definitely a fave! I ordered the Deluxe Chicken sandwich and it was divine!  Crispy on the outside, juicy on the inside!!

originalText.text:
One of my new favorite spots for a chicken sandwich. I've only tried only two of the eight different sandwiches, but am definitely going to keep coming to try them all, as they're freshly made!

Original crispy chicken sandwich (5/5) - Undoubtedly lives up to the restaurant name - krispy outside, juicy inside! This is one heck of a chicken sandwich, as you get a generous amount of meat, and the sauce just goes really well with the burger.

Soy garlic chicken sandwich (3.5/5) - The soy garlic chicken is really well made. The first bite was amazing, but after eating about 2/3 of the burger, the sweetness is a lil overwhelming. I recommended it to my coworker who loved it over the original crispy so I guess it's just preference.

The only con is that it can take some time for the order as it's freshly made, but it's well worth the wait!

originalText.text:
I eat fried chicken sandwiches more often than I should. This place was fire. Cajun sandwich was nice and spicy, but not so spicy that you can’t handle it.
Nashville sandwich kinda loses its spice due to the slaw but still great. One feedback would be more Nashville hot sauce.
The mega nuggets were pretty good too, I loved everything.
For the restaurant if you’re reading this: allow people to choose spice levels if possible, I would like spicier!
TLDR: definitely go, amazing place! Oh and I’m going back!
